ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with this course compared to others you have taken was:
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
How would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other F&ES courses you have taken?
Given the course objectives, the level of intellectual challenge of the material covered was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to respond to feedback and edit writing appropriately.
YER was a great opportunity to practice and hone writing for a non-scientific audience. I appreciated the skills I learnt during the course of the semester.
Writing for general audience
writing, critical thinking, analysis, editing
YER helped improve my writing and editing skills
Communicating scientific findings to an audience that may not be familiar with scientific terms

narratives.question_text: How well did the knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class align with your expectations?
comments: The knowledge gained aligned well with my expectations.
They aligned pretty well with my expectations.
Very well
perfectly well! I think Emma and Kate did a great job setting expectations for the course and clearly communicating what was expected from students
Extremely well

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of the course and how could it be improved?
comments: Kate and Emma did a great job of facilitating student involvement, even if much of it was via email. Perhaps class feedback into who a guest speaker could be, would be helpful.

The multiple rounds of editing involving not just the peer editors but writing coaches and group editing allows for a wide range of perspectives which is quite helpful. The pitch process helps practice a different form of communication. Also loved the guest lecture, would have liked more of those.
Great system for editing

Strengths were the organization and communicating expectations. Emma and Kate were really great and helpful with my writing and responsive to any questions or hesitations I had during the writing process. I think it would have been time consuming but maybe nice for editors to sit down with writers to go over pieces to discuss any confusing parts. It also might have been nice to have more guest speakers.
The course was well organized and all tasks were clearly outlined in the beginning. Emma and Kate were incredible teaching fellows and were wonderful to work with

Strengths - Great peer review mechanism, the writing tutors at FES are also very helpful Weaknesses - It may have been good to have the weekend to submit assignments, to allow more time to write and review independently

narratives.question_text: What advice would you give to a student considering taking this class?
comments: Write something you find interesting, not just something you think you should write about.
Make the most of the resources at your disposal!
I had never written for a publication before and would totally recommend it! The structure is really cool as you pitch ideas to your fellow students and really get to work together to choose pieces.
Be aware that 1.0 credit courses tend to involve more input than expected!
For a one credit course, you definitely learn a lot and every assignment has a clear purpose. This course does not feel like busy work and is an effective tool to hone your writing skills
Allocate enough time to revise your own writing, instead of waiting for feedback from the editors to make corrections.
